title: Hesai Technology showcased new automotive-grade hybrid solid-state Lidar AT128
summary: Hesai Technology showcased its new automotive-grade hybrid solid-state lidar AT128 at CES 2022. This long-range sensor is designed for L3+ ADAS applications in mass production vehicles, featuring image-level resolution, superior ranging capability, and automotive-grade reliability, with mass production slated for 2022. Hesai also unveiled the QT128, a short-range lidar aimed at L4 applications, entering mass production in Q1 2023.

title: Maze Therapeutics Nets $190M to Propel Precision Medicine Programs
summary: Maze Therapeutics secured $190 million in financing to advance its precision medicine pipeline, which includes nine programs. The company, founded in 2019, focuses on developing treatments for diseases like Pompe disease, Phenylketonuria, ALS, and chronic kidney disease, leveraging insights from human genetics. Matrix Capital Management led the new investment round, and Andy Tran from Matrix Capital Management joined Maze's board.

title: These 3 ETFs let you play the hot semiconductor sector, where Nvidia, Micron, AMD and others are growing sales rapidly
summary: This article highlights three ETFs that allow investors to gain exposure to the rapidly growing semiconductor sector, which includes companies like Nvidia, Micron, and AMD. Despite concerns about rising interest rates, the semiconductor industry continues to show strong growth, as evidenced by Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co.'s impressive Q4 sales and earnings report. The chip-focused exchange-traded funds have significantly outperformed both the S&P 500 and the Nasdaq over the past 15 years.

title: These 3 ETFs let you play the hot semiconductor sector, where Nvidia, Micron, AMD and others are growing sales rapidly
summary: This article highlights three ETFs that offer investors exposure to the rapidly growing semiconductor sector, featuring companies like Nvidia, Micron, and AMD. The chip-focused exchange-traded funds have significantly outperformed the S&P 500 and Nasdaq over the past 15 years, indicating their strong performance potential despite market pressures. The article also mentions Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. (TSM) reporting robust fourth-quarter sales and earnings, reinforcing the sector's positive outlook.

title: Silicon Labs Integrates AI/ML Acceleration in Low-power Wireless SoCs
summary: Silicon Labs has released two new families of wireless SoCs, BG24 and MG24, that integrate AI/ML accelerators for low-power IoT edge processing. These SoCs support a wide range of protocols and offer significant power reduction and speed increase for AI/ML applications. The company also introduced a software platform to aid developers in deploying AI/ML algorithms for various use cases, including smart home applications and medical devices.

title: Western Digital Taps Semiconductor Veteran for CFO Job
summary: Western Digital has appointed Wissam Jabre, a semiconductor industry veteran, as its new Chief Financial Officer. This move aligns with the hard-drive manufacturer's strategy to expand its memory-chip business. Mr. Jabre previously served as CFO at Dialog Semiconductor PLC and held finance roles at Advanced Micro Devices Inc. and Freescale Semiconductor Inc.

title: Reference design offers wireless docking over Wi-Fi 6E for PCs
summary: Synaptics Incorporated has introduced Gemini, a reference design that offers wireless docking over Wi-Fi 6E for PCs, claiming it's the world's first true Wi-Fi 6/6E wireless docking experience for laptops. This technology enables full dual-4K display capability and ultra-low latency, comparable to wired connections, and integrates hardware and software components like the BCM43752 Wi-Fi 6/6E radio and DL-1950 video interface IC. While initially focused on PC docking, Gemini's applications extend to tablets, gaming, and VR, with analyst Patrick Moorhead highlighting its potential to revolutionize connectivity in hybrid work environments.

title: Cadence Platform Accelerates Microchip’s Data Center Solutions SoC Development
summary: Microchip Technology Inc. has adopted Cadence's Palladium Z2 Enterprise Emulation Platform for the development of its next-generation ASIC products, specifically targeting high-performance and scalable SoC solutions for data centers. The Palladium Z2 platform offers Microchip 2X better emulation capacity and 1.5X greater performance, alongside seamless integration with Cadence's Protium Enterprise Prototyping system. This adoption significantly accelerates Microchip's time-to-market and quality requirements for complex multi-chip systems.

title: ETF Flows Cool Off as Stocks Stumble Out of the Gate
summary: January 2022 saw a significant cool-off in ETF flows and a stumble in stock markets globally, marking the worst monthly showing for the Morningstar Global Markets Index since March 2020. Fixed-income ETFs also experienced outflows, their first since March 2020, as investors reallocated their money amidst interest rate hike predictions and a strong performance from the energy sector. Vanguard dominated ETF provider flows, while drug and digital-asset focused ETFs appeared cheap, reflecting market turbulence and potential undervaluation.

title: Alphabet eyes $2 trillion value after blowout results
summary: Alphabet Inc. is on the verge of joining Apple and Microsoft in the $2 trillion market valuation club after a strong quarterly report led to an over 8% surge in its shares. The company also announced a 20-to-1 stock split, aiming to make shares more accessible to retail investors. At least 20 brokerages raised their price targets on Alphabet's stock.

title: SoftBank’s sale of Arm to Nvidia collapses, Arm to IPO
summary: The proposed sale of Arm Ltd by SoftBank Group Corp to U.S. chipmaker Nvidia Corp has collapsed due to regulatory hurdles and scrutiny from various international bodies. Instead of the sale, which was valued at up to $80 billion, Arm will now plan for an initial public offering (IPO). The deal faced opposition from U.S., British, EU, and Chinese regulators over concerns about competition, pricing, and innovation in vital chip markets.

title: Tower Semi deal won’t solve Intel’s margin issues, analysts say
summary: Intel's planned acquisition of Tower Semiconductor for $5.4 billion is unlikely to resolve its ongoing gross margin issues, according to analysts. While the deal aims to expand Intel's manufacturing capacity with new foundries, analysts suggest these additions focus on lower-margin production and will not help Intel become a leader in cutting-edge foundry technology. Wall Street has expressed dissatisfaction with Intel's declining gross margins, as CEO Pat Gelsinger invests in capacity building at the expense of immediate profitability.

title: Intel to Buy Israel’s Tower Semiconductor for $5.4 Billion
summary: Intel Corp. has agreed to acquire Israel’s Tower Semiconductor Ltd. for $5.4 billion as part of CEO Pat Gelsinger’s strategy to expand into the outsourced chip-manufacturing business. This acquisition aims to enhance Intel's expertise and customer base in the chip-foundry market, directly competing with industry leaders like Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. The deal is expected to close in about 12 months and is a key part of Intel's broader investment cycle to modernize its factories and rebuild manufacturing capabilities.

title: Nvidia Posts Record Sales Amid Broad Chip Demand
summary: Nvidia Corp. reported record quarterly sales of $7.64 billion, a 53% increase from the previous year, and projected further growth. The graphics-chip maker also more than doubled its net income to $3 billion, surpassing Wall Street expectations for both profit and sales. This strong performance comes amidst broad chip demand, despite the company moving past its failed takeover bid for Arm Ltd.

title: Use WGMI to Enter the Crypto Economy
summary: The crypto economy is diversifying beyond direct Bitcoin ownership, with new ETFs like the Valkyrie Bitcoin Miners ETF (WGMI) offering access. WGMI focuses on bitcoin mining equities and is actively managed, allowing it to adapt to a nascent asset class with high growth potential. The ETF also incorporates a renewable energy overlay for its mining components, addressing environmental concerns associated with bitcoin mining.

title: Nvidia hackers allegedly attempting to blackmail company into open-sourcing GPU drivers
summary: The Lapsus$ ransomware gang, responsible for a recent attack on Nvidia, is allegedly attempting to blackmail the company into open-sourcing its GPU drivers. The attackers have threatened to leak sensitive GPU files if Nvidia does not comply with their demands by a set deadline, which also included a previous request to remove mining hashrate limiters. Nvidia has confirmed a cybersecurity incident where employee credentials and proprietary information were stolen, but denies ransomware deployment.

title: EPAM Shares Continue to Fall on Ukraine Crisis & Russia Exit
summary: EPAM Systems' shares fell significantly due to the escalating Russia-Ukraine crisis and the company's decision to exit Russia. EPAM, with substantial exposure in Eastern Europe, announced it would discontinue services in Russia and offer humanitarian aid to Ukrainian employees, aligning with U.S. sanctions. The conflict is expected to impact the company's revenues and profitability due to its large workforce in the affected regions.

title: Is It Finally Time to Start Buying Intel Stock?
summary: Intel, a pioneer in micro-processing, has seen its stock underperform competitors for years, but an ambitious makeover and new leadership may signal an attractive entry point for long-term investors. CEO Pat Gelsinger's plans for a massive $20 billion semiconductor plant in Ohio and other investments aim to restore Intel's market leadership. Despite investor skepticism reflected in its depressed stock price, Morningstar analysts see an appealing opportunity with a 27% discount to its fair value estimate and a 3.11% dividend yield.

title: NVIDIA Launches Omniverse for Developers: A Powerful and Collaborative Game Creation Environment
summary: NVIDIA has launched new Omniverse features for developers, creating a powerful and collaborative environment for game creation. This update streamlines game development by integrating AI and NVIDIA RTX tools, enabling real-time collaboration and enhancing character animation and asset management. Key new features include Omniverse Audio2Face, Omniverse Nucleus Cloud, Omniverse DeepSearch, and an Unreal Engine 5 Omniverse Connector.

title: Tackling Global Supply Chain Disruption
summary: This article discusses how Microsoft has addressed global supply chain disruptions caused by the pandemic, focusing on leveraging technology for agility and resilience. It highlights digitizing factories, using AI/machine learning for data and logistics, and integrating sustainability. The article also introduces Microsoft's Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Insights as a solution for organizations seeking to build resilient supply chains.

title: Nvidia considers teaming up with Intel on chip manufacturing
summary: Nvidia is in discussions with Intel about potentially using Intel as a foundry for manufacturing its chips. This consideration comes amid a global semiconductor chip shortage and Intel's efforts to become a major U.S. foundry supplier, despite the challenges of aligning technologies and business models between the companies. Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang expressed openness to the idea, noting existing close collaboration between the firms.

title: The Top 5: Biggest Automotive Semiconductor Manufacturers
summary: The automotive semiconductor market, valued at $43.6 billion in 2021, is projected to exceed $115 billion by 2030, driven by the growth of electric vehicles and autonomous technologies. This article identifies the top five automotive semiconductor manufacturers, excluding TSMC which dominates the foundry market, and details their market share, financial performance, and strategic investments. The leading companies are Infineon Technologies AG, NXP Semiconductors N.V., Renesas Electronics Corp., Texas Instruments, Inc., and STMicroelectronics N.V.

title: Synopsys Launches Industry's First Broad-Scale Cloud SaaS Solution to Transform Chip Development Landscape
summary: Synopsys has launched Synopsys Cloud, the industry's first broad-scale cloud Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) solution for chip development. This new model, optimized for electronic design automation (EDA) and deployed on Microsoft Azure, offers a pay-per-use approach to provide unparalleled flexibility and efficiency for complex chip designs. The collaboration with Microsoft aims to streamline access to compute and EDA resources, addressing the escalating demands of chip design and verification.

title: The semiconductor decade: A trillion-dollar industry
summary: The global semiconductor industry is projected to reach a trillion-dollar valuation by 2030, driven by an average annual growth rate of 6 to 8 percent. Key growth areas include automotive, computation and data storage, and wireless technologies, with automotive expected to triple demand. Industry leaders are advised to strategically focus on R&D, manufacturing, and sourcing to capitalize on this expansion.

title: Technology ETF
summary: VanEck offers a suite of Technology ETFs that allow investors to gain exposure to disruptive and transformative megatrends such as semiconductors, spatial technology, hydrogen, esports, and cryptocurrency. These ETFs provide diversified exposure, potential for future winners through rules-based selection, regular rebalancing, and lower fees compared to actively managed funds. The article also details various risks associated with investing in Technology ETFs, including industry concentration, market risk, and liquidity risks.

title: Which is the bigger company: AMD, Nvidia, or Intel?
summary: This article analyzes Intel, AMD, and Nvidia to determine which is the "bigger" company, looking beyond market capitalization to factors like employee count, revenue, product diversity, and market share. While Nvidia leads in market cap, sustained analysis reveals Intel to be the largest overall due to its revenue and employee numbers, despite AMD and Nvidia's significant recent growth. The article also touches on the unique advantage Intel holds with its chip manufacturing capabilities.

title: Do Penny Stocks Ever Make Money? Here Are 7 Success Stories
summary: This article highlights seven former penny stocks that achieved significant profitability and provided substantial returns for early investors. It demonstrates that while penny stocks are high-risk, those companies that eventually become profitable can offer life-changing gains. The article details the financial turnaround and stock performance of Advanced Micro Devices, BBQ Holdings, Syndax Pharmaceuticals, VAALCO Energy, Digital Turbine, eXp World Holdings, and The Joint Corp.

title: The end of one-chip wonders: Why Nvidia, Intel and AMD’s valuations have experienced massive upheaval
summary: This article discusses the dramatic shift in market capitalization within the semiconductor industry over the past five years. Once dominant Intel has been surpassed by Nvidia, which is now valued as much as Intel and AMD combined, reflecting fundamental changes in how technology is used and specialized solutions. This upheaval highlights a significant transformation in the industry's landscape.

title: The end of one-chip wonders: Why Nvidia, Intel and AMD’s valuations have experienced massive upheaval
summary: The article discusses the dramatic shift in valuations among semiconductor companies, specifically Nvidia, Intel, and AMD. Five years ago, Intel's market capitalization surpassed Nvidia and AMD combined, but now Nvidia alone is worth more than the other two combined, reflecting significant changes in the semiconductor industry. This upheaval is attributed to evolving technology consumption patterns and companies specializing in new areas.

title: Why dividend ETFs may not be worthwhile
summary: This article examines the viability of dividend ETFs, concluding that many are not worthwhile after accounting for taxes, fees, and capital distributions. The author discusses challenges like 30% dividend taxation for foreign investors in US ETFs, poor underlying stock performance in high-yield ETFs, and issues with capital distributions eroding value. Alternative options in Singapore, UK, and Hong Kong are also explored, but ultimately deemed insufficient, leading to the recommendation that investors build their own dividend portfolios.

title: Latest Oracle Exadata servers ascend to the cloud
summary: Oracle has announced the availability of its latest Exadata Cloud Infrastructure X9M appliance in Oracle Cloud Infrastructure, marking the rollout of its newest generation of Exadata processors. This new service, based on AMD microprocessors, offers significant improvements in performance, throughput, and capacity without increased costs, allowing organizations to consolidate various database workloads. Oracle claims superior performance compared to AWS RDS and Azure SQL, with the service designed for scalable deployment both on-premises and across Oracle's expanding global cloud footprint.

title: HPE Creates Its Own AI Stack For Large Enterprises
summary: Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) is expanding its AI software portfolio and leveraging its HPC hardware expertise to provide a comprehensive AI stack for large enterprises. This initiative includes a Machine Learning Development System that simplifies infrastructure management and facilitates collaboration for training models at scale, addressing the complexities faced by data scientists. Furthermore, HPE is promoting "swarm learning" to enable AI model training where data resides, crucial for privacy and compliance in industries like healthcare and banking.

title: Advisors Are Powering Portfolios With Thematic ETFs
summary: Thematic ETFs, which invest in companies poised to benefit from long-term transformative changes, are increasingly being adopted by financial advisors as a replacement for traditional sector funds. These ETFs offer more precise exposure to growth trends like blockchain, emergent food, robotics, and electric vehicles. Asset managers are expanding their thematic ETF offerings, with BlackRock (iShares) recently launching two new products in this space, highlighting a growing conviction in the long-term benefits of thematic investing despite some recent market volatility.

title: New HP Chromebooks and Thin Clients Power Cloud-First Computing for Hybrid Work
summary: HP is launching new Chromebooks and Thin Clients, alongside software and device management solutions, tailored for hybrid work environments and cloud-first computing strategies. The new products, including the HP Elite c645 G2 and c640 G3 Chromebook Enterprises, and HP Elite t655 Thin Client, offer enhanced security, performance, and collaboration features designed to support mission-critical workers and IT teams. HP is also introducing HP Cloud Endpoint Manager for real-time thin client management and HP ThinPro 8.0 OS, emphasizing sustainability in its PC portfolio.

title: Intel Nabs Former AMD Exec Matt Poirier To Lead M&A Quest
summary: Intel has appointed former AMD executive Matt Poirier as senior vice president of corporate development, effective May 30, to lead its mergers and acquisitions strategy. Poirier, who previously focused on M&A at AMD and Xilinx, will report directly to CEO Pat Gelsinger. This move comes as Intel actively pursues acquisitions, including recent deals for Tower Semiconductor and Siru Innovations, and highlights the growing importance of M&A for Intel's expansion in various technology sectors.

title: Pave the Way for Next Wireless Breakthroughs
summary: This article discusses the accelerating pace of wireless innovation, focusing on the design and test challenges posed by next-generation wireless communication systems like 5G and satellite communications. It highlights key technological components such as wider bandwidths, higher-order modulation schemes, and multi-antenna techniques, and emphasizes the need for scalable and accurate test solutions to overcome these challenges. The author, Eric Hsu of Keysight Technologies Inc., explains how these advancements impact device performance and require sophisticated testing methods.

title: Nvidia pays $5.5m SEC fine over crypto-mining disclosures
summary: Nvidia agreed to pay a $5.5 million fine to the SEC for failing to adequately disclose revenue from crypto mining during two quarters in 2018. The SEC stated that Nvidia omitted information about surging demand from crypto miners while discussing how digital assets impacted other business lines. This lack of disclosure made Nvidia's financial results less predictable for investors.

title: Ex-Cisco chief John Chambers says Silicon Valley's in trouble, but it's not too late to fix things
summary: Former Cisco Systems CEO John Chambers believes Silicon Valley and the U.S. are entering one of their most difficult periods in his 46-year tech career. Despite the challenges, Chambers remains optimistic that solutions can be found. He shared these views with the Silicon Valley Business Journal, highlighting concerns for the region and the nation.

title: Nvidia Q1 FY2023 Earnings Report Preview: What To Look For
summary: Nvidia (NVDA) is set to report Q1 FY 2023 earnings, with analysts expecting growth in adjusted EPS and revenue, albeit at a slower pace. Investors will closely watch data center revenue, which is projected to accelerate and potentially surpass gaming revenue for the first time in FY 2023. The company is investing in AI chips to continue its growth trajectory, building on demand fueled by the pandemic.

title: Semiconductor ETF | ESG-screened investment in tech
summary: The VanEck Semiconductor UCITS ETF offers investors exposure to the semiconductor sector, targeting pure-play companies with at least half their revenues from semiconductors. It is Europe's first Semiconductor ETF, designed to capture growth from the "fourth industrial revolution" driven by semiconductor advancements, and is classified as SFDR Article 8 for promoting environmental and social characteristics. The ETF focuses on liquid semiconductor stocks globally and has a strategy that has been successful in the US since 2011, with $25 billion in AUM.

title: Qualcomm maintains multiple sourcing strategy
summary: Qualcomm Inc. has stated it will maintain a multi-sourcing strategy for its chips, including advanced chips from two major suppliers, to ensure a stable supply amidst the pandemic and a slowing global economy. The company anticipates continued strong growth in 5G penetration and expects Wi-Fi 7 technology adoption to rapidly increase, with end products equipped with these chips by the end of this year.

title: Best semiconductor ETFs in the UK 2023
summary: This article provides a comprehensive guide to semiconductor Exchange Traded Funds (ETFs) available to UK investors, explaining what an ETF is, the history and importance of semiconductors, and how to evaluate investment opportunities in this sector. It highlights top-performing semiconductor ETFs, discusses the significance of UCITS, and addresses considerations for ESG-minded investors, particularly concerning ON Semiconductor.

title: Gen-trepreneur Z is making its mark on the future of small business
summary: A Microsoft Store report "Small Business State of Mind" highlights how Generation Z is redefining entrepreneurship. Gen Z small business owners prioritize social good, work unconventional hours, and are using platforms like TikTok for business advice, aiming for early retirement rather than traditional corporate paths. The article emphasizes their unique perspective on work, success, and the future of small business, despite challenges like inflation and data security risks.

title: Amid domestic semiconductor wave, Texas Instruments begins $30B build
summary: Texas Instruments has broken ground on an estimated $30 billion semiconductor manufacturing facility in Sherman, Texas, which is the largest private sector investment in Texas history. Production is slated to begin in 2025, creating up to 3,000 direct jobs and contributing to a nationwide effort to increase domestic chip manufacturing. This project aligns with a broader industry trend of expanding semiconductor fabrication in the U.S., driven by rising demand and supply chain challenges.

title: These software companies are unsung winners in the semiconductor industry
summary: This article highlights software companies like Synopsys Inc. (SNPS) and Cadence Design Systems Inc. (CDNS) as critical but often overlooked players in the semiconductor industry. These companies provide Electronic Design Automation (EDA) software, which is essential for chip design engineers. Despite the focus on chip giants, these software firms play a crucial role in enabling the broader semiconductor sector, especially amidst ongoing chip shortages.

title: HPE Is The First Big OEM To Adopt Ampere Computing Arm Chips
summary: HPE has announced its adoption of Ampere Computing's "Mystique" Altra Max Arm server chip in its standard ProLiant rack-mounted server, marking Ampere's first major OEM server maker partnership. This move, showcased with the ProLiant RL300 server, signifies HPE's renewed commitment to Arm-based processors after previous cautious ventures. The decision is driven by the Altra chips' deterministic performance and competitive price/performance, particularly for cloud-native workloads, positioning HPE to compete aggressively against Intel Xeon and AMD Epyc processors.

title: Direxion SOXL ETF: How To Trade This Leveraged Play On Semis (NYSEARCA:SOXL)
summary: This article discusses the Direxion Daily Semiconductor Bull 3X Shares ETF (SOXL), a 3X leveraged ETF on the semiconductor index. Despite SOXL being down 85% this year, the author advises against buying it immediately. The recommendation is to wait for signs of a bottom in the broader semiconductor index (SOXX) before initiating a position in SOXL.

title: Micron Announces Availability of DDR5 DRAM For Next-Gen Intel & AMD Server and Workstation Platforms
summary: Micron has announced the commercial and industrial availability of its DDR5 DRAM specifically designed for next-generation Intel and AMD server and workstation platforms. This new DDR5 memory is expected to dramatically increase system performance by up to 85% over DDR4, catering to demanding AI, HPC, and data-intensive applications. Micron has been a key player in the development of DDR5 specifications and offers support through its Technology Enablement Program.

title: Intel To Hike Chip Prices As Semiconductor Giant Deals With Inflation
summary: Intel has announced price increases across its product lines, including chipsets and microprocessors, by as much as 20 percent, effective in Q4 2022. The company attributes these hikes to inflationary pressures, rising material costs, and increased production expenses. Other companies in the semiconductor industry, including TSMC and various material suppliers, are also implementing price increases, suggesting a broader trend of rising costs in the tech sector.

title: Rambus Spins DDR5 DIMM Interface ICs for Data Center Servers
summary: Rambus has unveiled new SPD (serial presence detect) hub and temperature sensor ICs, completing its DDR5 DIMM interface chipset. These new chips, alongside their existing Registering Clock Driver (RCD), provide a comprehensive solution for DDR5 memory modules in PCs and data center servers. The article details the technical advantages of DDR5 over DDR4, emphasizing the role of these new components in optimizing performance, capacity, and thermal management for modern computing demands.

title: Steward Partners Investment Advisory LLC Purchases New Position in ZIM Integrated Shipping Services Ltd. (NYSE:ZIM)
summary: Steward Partners Investment Advisory LLC has acquired a new position in ZIM Integrated Shipping Services Ltd. (NYSE:ZIM) during the first quarter, purchasing 9,268 shares valued at approximately $674,000. Several other institutional investors also adjusted their holdings in ZIM, while analysts have issued varying ratings and price targets for the stock. The article also details ZIM's price performance, financial ratios, recent earnings, and dividend information.

title: Meet Ross Freeman, Inventor of the First FPGA
summary: This article introduces Ross Freeman, the inventor of the first FPGA, detailing his life from a Peace Corps volunteer to a pioneer in modern computing. It highlights his role in founding Xilinx and his radical vision for the FPGA, which transformed the semiconductor industry. The piece also acknowledges his enduring legacy through Xilinx's market dominance and the annual Ross Freeman Award for Technical Innovation.

title: Russian weapons in Ukraine powered by hundreds of Western parts: Defense think tank
summary: A new report by the Royal United Services Institute (RUSI) defense think tank reveals that more than 450 foreign-made components, primarily from Western companies, have been found in Russian weapons recovered in Ukraine. These components, despite export controls for some, were acquired by Moscow over years before the invasion. The findings highlight Russia's military reliance on foreign microchips and suggest that stricter export controls and enforcement could hinder Russia's ability to replenish its arsenal.

title: Nvidia is hit by another ‘crypto hangover,’ and that isn’t the only problem
summary: Nvidia is facing a "crypto hangover" and other issues as the pandemic-era booms in PC sales, videogames, and cryptocurrency decline. The company warned of a $1.4 billion revenue shortfall due to weak gaming equipment sales and excess inventory. Nvidia's stock fell 6.3% on the news, reflecting broader concerns about multiple challenges impacting its core business.

title: Chipmakers tumble on fears of worst downturn in 10 years
summary: Semiconductor stocks experienced a significant downturn following Micron Technology Inc.'s warning of slowing demand, raising concerns about the industry heading into a prolonged slump. Analysts believe the sector is entering its worst downturn in a decade, affecting every company and end market. Despite recent shortages and investments, the rapid evaporation of demand has taken experts by surprise, with some companies like Micron already cutting future spending.

title: Thematic Times: Semiconductors Power Thematic Indexes
summary: The article discusses how semiconductor stocks are crucial to many thematic indexes, particularly after the CHIPS and Science Act. It highlights direct and indirect exposure of various thematic indexes to semiconductors and the long-term benefits of the CHIPS Act for the industry and end users. The growth of the semiconductor market is primarily driven by the automotive sector, data storage, and wireless communications.

title: New U.S. curbs on sales of Nvidia AI chips to China spark selloff
summary: New U.S. restrictions on exports of advanced AI chips from Nvidia and AMD to China have caused Nvidia's stock to fall over 11%. The curbs, aimed at limiting China's technological prowess, specifically target Nvidia's H100 and A100 chips which are crucial for AI and machine learning applications. While potentially impacting Nvidia's business in China, the U.S. government has made some allowances for the completion and support of the H100 chip.

title: Arm sues Qualcomm, aiming to unwind Qualcomm's $1.4 bln Nuvia purchase
summary: Arm Ltd. has sued Qualcomm Inc. and its recently acquired chip design firm Nuvia Inc. for breach of license agreements and trademark infringement, seeking to unwind Qualcomm's $1.4 billion Nuvia purchase. Arm is requesting an injunction that would compel Qualcomm to destroy designs developed under Nuvia’s license agreements with Arm, alleging its approval was needed before the transfer to Qualcomm. This lawsuit signifies a major rift between two key technology partners, as Qualcomm had acquired Nuvia to boost its custom computing core designs and challenge competitors in the PC market.

title: Skyworks (SWKS) Unveils Network Synchronization Solutions
summary: Skyworks Solutions (SWKS) has launched new network synchronization solutions, including Si551x and Si540x products and AccuTime IEEE 1588 software, to support 5G fronthaul networks with precise time synchronization. These solutions, developed in partnership with NXP Semiconductors and Advanced Micro Devices, are crucial for emerging 5G applications and the IoT. Despite a challenging macroeconomic environment and competition, Skyworks aims to leverage organic growth and an expanding product portfolio to capitalize on 5G and IoT megatrends.

title: Meta, Qualcomm sign pact on custom virtual reality chips | Hindustan Times
summary: Meta Platforms Inc. and Qualcomm Inc. have signed an agreement for Qualcomm to produce custom chipsets for Meta's Quest virtual reality (VR) devices. This collaboration highlights Meta's reliance on Qualcomm's technology while it also develops its own custom silicon for its VR, augmented, and mixed reality devices. The financial terms of the deal were not disclosed, and the custom chipsets will be optimized for Quest's system specifications, though not exclusive to Meta.

title: Game on: Why esports and gaming could take it to the next level
summary: The esports and gaming sector, a multi-billion-dollar industry, continues to grow despite recent slowdowns attributed to supply chain delays and shifting consumer choices post-pandemic. Analysts and industry experts are confident in long-term growth, citing upcoming title launches and easing parts shortages. Mobile gaming remains the primary driver of revenue growth globally, while esports is gaining mainstream traction with significant investment and increasing popularity in emerging markets.

title: Supermicro Announces 8U H100 HGX Server
summary: Supermicro has announced its new 8U Universal GPU Server, incorporating eight NVIDIA H100 Tensor Core GPUs, designed for large-scale AI training, NVIDIA Omniverse, and Metaverse applications. This server increases AI performance with improved thermal density, enabling lower power consumption and operation at higher data center temperatures, while supporting both current and next-generation CPUs and GPUs. The company is expanding its leading GPU server lineup with this addition, offering flexibility with front and rear I/O, AC or DC power support, and liquid cooling options.

title: NVIDIA Delivers Quantum Leap in Performance, Introduces New Era of Neural Rendering With GeForce RTX 40 Series
summary: NVIDIA unveiled its new GeForce RTX 40 Series GPUs, powered by the Ada Lovelace architecture and new DLSS 3 technology, promising up to 4x performance improvement for gamers and creators. The flagship RTX 4090 and two configurations of the RTX 4080 were introduced, alongside new features like neural rendering and RTX Remix for classic games. These advancements aim to redefine real-time ray tracing, AI-powered graphics, and creative workflows.

title: Nvidia’s new AI-focused chip produces more realistic images in games
summary: Nvidia Corp. has unveiled its new AI-focused graphics chip, the RTX 4090, which is designed to produce more realistic images in games by combining AI with traditional pixel calculations. The high-end chip, costing US$1,599, features 76 billion transistors and 24GB of memory, and will go on sale October 12, with other versions following in November. This launch aims to give customers a reason to upgrade amidst a slowdown in PC component demand.

title: Supermicro Delivers Second-Generation NVIDIA® OVX™ Computing System for 3D Collaboration, Metaverse, and Digital Twin Simulation, Powered by the New NVIDIA L40 GPU
summary: Supermicro announced the release of its second-generation NVIDIA OVX computing system, powered by the new NVIDIA L40 GPU, designed for 3D collaboration, metaverse, and digital twin simulation. These new servers aim to provide the necessary graphics, AI, and network performance for building and operating immersive 3D virtual worlds at data center scale. The systems will support up to eight NVIDIA L40 GPUs, ConnectX-7 SmartNICs, and current/future CPU processors from Intel and AMD.

title: Intel Unveils New Chips and Software as It Chases a Comeback (INTC)
summary: Intel Corp. introduced new personal-computer processors, graphics semiconductors, and software as part of its strategy to regain its position in the chip industry. The new lineup includes Core desktop processors for high-performance users and a graphics chip named Ponte Vecchio for data centers, aimed at challenging Nvidia. These announcements were made at Intel's Innovate event, showcasing their efforts towards a comeback.

title: Micron’s big new Boise fab will slow US economy, bring higher taxes and worse
summary: Economist Peter Crabb argues that Micron Technology's new $15 billion Boise semiconductor plant, despite being seen as an economic boon, will likely slow the U.S. economy and lead to higher taxes due to federal subsidies and government borrowing. He also suggests that Micron's shareholders will face higher costs and a lower return on investment, as indicated by the company's stock performance and low price-to-earnings ratio compared to peers. Crabb emphasizes the often-overlooked long-term economic consequences of such large-scale, government-subsidized projects.

title: Meta launches AI software tools to ease switching between Nvidia, AMD chips
summary: Meta Platforms Inc. has launched new open-source AI software tools to enable easier switching between different underlying chips from Nvidia and AMD. These tools, based on PyTorch, can significantly speed up code execution on both Nvidia A100 and AMD MI250 chips, offering developers greater flexibility and reducing migration costs between hardware vendors. This initiative aims to address the vendor lock-in common with Nvidia's CUDA platform and improve hardware choice for deep learning developers.

title: Ethereum Merge Not Yet Boosting Crypto Stocks
summary: The Ethereum merge has not yet boosted crypto-correlated stocks, despite being a highly anticipated event. This is largely because most publicly traded crypto miners focus on Bitcoin rather than Ether. However, there's ongoing hope that the merge will have positive long-term effects on crypto equities and ETFs like SATO and BLKC, partly by benefiting companies involved in staking, such as Coinbase, and GPU manufacturers like Nvidia and AMD.

title: Ethereum Merge Not Yet Boosting Crypto Stocks
summary: The Ethereum merge has not yet boosted crypto-correlated stocks, including holdings in ETFs like SATO and BLKC, partly because most public crypto miners focus on Bitcoin. However, the switch to staking could benefit companies like Coinbase through increased revenue from staking services, potentially offering longer-term upsides for crypto equities and related ETFs. The article notes that ETH mining equipment is cheaper and more flexible than BTC mining equipment, using GPUs, which could benefit companies like Nvidia and AMD.

title: The Chips That Make Taiwan the Center of the World
summary: This article examines Taiwan's critical role in the global semiconductor industry, particularly through TSMC, and the geopolitical risks associated with its dependence on the island amid rising U.S.-China tensions. It explores the potential catastrophic economic consequences for the world if military action or political pressure disrupts Taiwan's chip manufacturing capabilities. The author argues that while Taiwan's chip industry provides a "silicon shield," it also makes the island a crucial target in any conflict.

title: IBM to invest $20 billion in New York's Hudson Valley region over 10 years
summary: IBM announced plans to invest $20 billion in New York's Hudson Valley region over the next 10 years, coinciding with a visit from President Joe Biden to its Poughkeepsie site. This investment aims to boost the technology ecosystem in New York, focusing on semiconductors, computers, hybrid cloud, artificial intelligence, and quantum computing. IBM anticipates direct benefits from the CHIPS and Science Act, ensuring a stable supply of next-generation chips.

title: U.S. aims to hobble China’s chip industry with sweeping new export rules
summary: The Biden administration has enacted sweeping new export controls designed to significantly impede China's semiconductor industry. These rules aim to cut China off from certain chips made with U.S. tools globally and restrict the sale of advanced chip-making equipment, potentially setting China's chip manufacturing back by years. The U.S. acknowledges that the effectiveness of these unilateral controls depends on allied nations adopting similar measures.

title: U.S. aims to hobble China's chip industry with sweeping new export rules
summary: The Biden administration has enacted broad new export controls to impede China's chip industry, specifically targeting its access to advanced semiconductors made with U.S. equipment. These measures expand prior restrictions and are designed to slow Beijing's technological and military advancements, although their effectiveness relies on international cooperation. The rules are expected to significantly impact China's chip manufacturing capabilities, potentially setting the industry back years.

title: China’s Biren GPUs Can’t Be Made at TSMC Due To US Regulations & Competition With NVIDIA
summary: Birentech, a Chinese chip startup, is reportedly barred from manufacturing its Biren GPUs at TSMC due to US regulations aimed at restricting China's access to advanced AI and datacenter chips. This decision is influenced by the Biren BR100's potential to outperform NVIDIA's A100 chips, which are already banned for the Chinese market, and could severely impact Birentech's manufacturing plans.

title: MKS Instruments Maintains Quarterly Dividend at $0.22 Per Share; Payable Dec. 9 to Shareholders of Record on Nov. 28
summary: MKS Instruments has announced that it will maintain its quarterly dividend at $0.22 per share. The dividend is set to be payable on December 9 to shareholders of record as of November 28. This decision reflects the company's continued commitment to returning value to its shareholders.

title: Why Are Semiconductor Shares Being Crushed?
summary: Semiconductor stocks are facing significant declines in 2022 due to multiple factors, including recession fears, weak PC sales, and strict US export restrictions on sales to China. These restrictions are expected to heavily impact major companies like Nvidia and AMD, although the long-term growth outlook for the overall semiconductor market remains positive, albeit with near-term uncertainties.

title: Mobileye pops more than 37% in market debut after spinning out of Intel
summary: Mobileye, Intel's self-driving car technology company, saw its shares surge over 37% in its stock market debut after spinning out of Intel. The IPO, which valued Mobileye at around $17 billion, raised $861 million, with Intel planning to use some proceeds to build chip factories. This market debut provides a notable tech IPO in a slow year, despite Mobileye's valuation being below Intel's initial expectations.

title: Micron Ships World's Most Advanced DRAM Technology With 1-Beta Node
summary: Micron Technology has announced it is shipping qualification samples of its 1β (1-beta) DRAM technology to select smartphone manufacturers and chipset partners, achieving mass production readiness for the world's most advanced DRAM technology node. This LPDDR5X mobile memory delivers top speeds of 8.5 gigabits per second, with significant gains in power efficiency (15% improvement) and bit density (over 35% improvement) at 16Gb per die capacity. The 1β node is poised to support highly responsive applications from mobile to data centers and intelligent vehicles, stemming from Micron's pioneering R&D and nanomanufacturing capabilities.

title: High-density MRAM family now commercially available
summary: Everspin Technologies Inc. has commercially launched its EMxxLX family of high-density MRAM devices, touted as the highest performing persistent memory available. These MRAM devices offer superior performance compared to traditional memories like SRAM and NOR flash, suitable for diverse applications including industrial IoT, aerospace, and medical systems. The technology boasts low latency, non-volatility, high endurance, and radiation resistance, with densities ranging from 8 to 64 megabits.

title: BDA advises onsemi on sale of Niigata foundry to Mercuria, Sangyo Sosei, Fukuoka Capital
summary: BDA Partners advised onsemi on the sale of its Niigata wafer manufacturing facility in Japan to investment vehicles managed by Mercuria Holdings Co Ltd, Sangyo Sosei Advisory Inc, and Fukuoka Capital Partners Co Ltd. This transaction will create Japan's first independent specialty semiconductor foundry. The sale is expected to close upon regulatory approvals and fulfillment of closing conditions.

title: How Taiwan won the semiconductor race
summary: This article explains how Taiwan became a dominant force in the global semiconductor industry, despite starting as an agricultural economy. It attributes Taiwan's success to globalization's impact on electronics, East Asia's skilled workforce and infrastructure, and a unique business model focused on contract manufacturing rather than brand development. The piece highlights TSMC's role in supplying advanced chips globally, creating a significant dependency on Taiwan.

title: Exclusive: Nvidia offers new advanced chip for China that meets U.S. export controls
summary: Nvidia has developed a new advanced chip, the A800, specifically for the Chinese market, which complies with recent U.S. export control rules designed to restrict cutting-edge technology to China. This move by Nvidia (NVDA.O) is a strategic effort to maintain its presence in the significant Chinese market after U.S. regulations impacted sales of its A100 chip, with the A800 featuring a reduced data transfer rate to meet the export requirements. Analysts suggest this is a "repackaged A100 GPU" demonstrating Nvidia's adaptability to trade restrictions.

title: Nvidia’s new chip is tailored for Chinese market and meets US export regulations
summary: Nvidia has introduced a new A800 GPU specifically designed for the Chinese market to comply with US export regulations, which previously banned sales of its A100 and H100 chips without a license. This move allows Nvidia to continue serving its Chinese customers, who represent about a quarter of its gross sales, while adhering to US government’s restrictions on advanced chip technology. The A800 is an alternative product engineered to meet reduced export control requirements and cannot be programmed to exceed them.

title: Samsung Secures 3-nm Advanced Chip Orders From NVIDIA, Qualcomm – Report
summary: Samsung Foundry has reportedly secured orders from major firms like NVIDIA, Qualcomm, IBM, and Baidu to manufacture advanced 3-nanometer chips. This move, leveraging Samsung's gate-all-around (GAA) transistor technology developed with IBM, aims to position Samsung ahead of TSMC in advanced chip manufacturing and diversify the semiconductor supply chain amidst geopolitical tensions. Deliveries in large quantities are expected to begin in early 2024.

title: Micron Technology to invest RM4.4bil on 2nd factory in Penang
summary: Micron Technology announced a new investment of US$1 billion (RM4.4 billion) to build a second factory in Penang, adding to its existing US$1 billion investment since 2019. This expansion will bring their total factory space to 1.5 million sq ft and is expected to begin production next year. CEO Sanjay Mehrotra highlights the company's strong position in the semiconductor market despite current industry challenges, emphasizing the critical role of its Penang operations in its global network.

title: TSMC Announces Updates for TSMC Arizona
summary: TSMC announced significant updates for its Arizona fabs, including starting construction on a second fab for 3nm production by 2026, bringing the total investment to approximately US$40 billion. The two fabs are projected to create 10,000 high-paying jobs and produce over 600,000 wafers annually. TSMC also plans an on-site Industrial Water Reclamation Plant for near zero liquid discharge, aiming for the greenest semiconductor manufacturing facility in the US.

title: New business to bring more jobs to Plainview
summary: A new joint venture called DSM Semichem LLC. is set to begin construction on a facility in Plainview, Texas, in January, which will produce electronic sulfuric acid (ELSA) and create new jobs. This development is a result of Samsung's investment in a Texas facility and its need for local resources. The Plainview location will be the first U.S. facility for Dongjin Semichem Co., Ltd., and its operations are anticipated to begin after January 1, with full operation planned by the end of 2024.

title: Red-Hot Solar Stock Earns 'Top Pick' Status
summary: Goldman Sachs has named SolarEdge Technologies Inc (NASDAQ:SEDG) as a top pick for 2023 in the solar energy industry, alongside First Solar (FSLR). This endorsement comes despite the stock being down 1.1% recently, as SEDG has shown a 37% gain this quarter and boasts strong support from its 20-day moving average. Options traders have also been overwhelmingly bullish on SEDG in the past two months, as indicated by a high call/put volume ratio.

title: Micron Technology Sees Chip Recovery by the End of 2023
summary: Micron Technology Inc. stock has fallen significantly in 2022 due to weak demand for DRAM chips and an oversupply in the market. Despite a challenging fiscal Q1 2023 with missed earnings and lowered guidance, Micron expects improving customer inventories to lead to increased revenue in the fiscal second half of 2023. Analysts have revised their ratings and price targets, with some maintaining overweight or buy ratings despite the current downturn.

title: Sales of computer graphics cards slump to lowest level in two decades
summary: Sales of computer graphics cards hit a 20-year low in Q3 2022 due to a global economic slowdown and the impact of the Ethereum merge on cryptocurrency mining. Major chipmakers like AMD and Nvidia experienced significant declines in discrete desktop GPU shipments, with AMD particularly hard hit. Despite the slump, new high-end GPU launches and Intel's entry into the market (grabbing a 4% share) offer potential for future sales boosts.

title: CES 2023: AMD, Nvidia, auto applications get the hype, but analysts say this one chip maker ruled
summary: At CES 2023, while companies like Advanced Micro Devices Inc. and Nvidia Corp. received significant attention, analysts suggest that a lower-profile chip maker is better positioned post-convention. Morgan Stanley analyst Joseph Moore noted ongoing caution regarding overall chip demand, particularly due to softness in China, but highlighted autos as a strong theme at the event.

title: AMD poaches Marvell’s Jean Hu for CFO slot as Devinder Kumar retires
summary: Advanced Micro Devices Inc. announced that its financial chief Devinder Kumar is retiring, and Jean Hu from Marvell Technology Inc. will take his place as CFO. Marvell confirmed Hu's departure effective January 20, while AMD expects Hu to start on January 23. This change marks a significant leadership transition for AMD's financial department.

title: March 3rd Options Now Available For Advanced Micro Devices (AMD)
summary: New options contracts for Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) with a March 3rd expiration date are now available. Investors can consider a put contract at a $68.00 strike price with a current bid of $4.50, potentially leading to a 6.62% return if it expires worthless. Alternatively, a covered call strategy using a $72.00 strike price contract with a current bid of $3.70 could yield a 10.32% return if the stock is called away.

title: AMD is making history for Asian women executives
summary: Advanced Micro Devices Inc. is making history by appointing Jean Hu as CFO, resulting in an S&P 500 company led by women of Asian descent in the Chair, CEO, and CFO roles. This move is significant given the barriers Asian-American women face in reaching C-suite positions. Hu will transition into her role starting Jan. 23, succeeding Devinder Kumar.

title: T.J. Rodgers has brought in a pair of chip industry vets to right the ship at Enovix
summary: T.J. Rodgers, executive chairman and major shareholder of Enovix, has brought in new leadership from the chip industry to turn around the struggling battery maker. Raj Talluri, formerly of Qualcomm, has been appointed CEO, tasked with instilling a "silicon mindset" following production setbacks. This move aims to stabilize Enovix's operations and strategy.

title: AMD can keep eating Intel’s lunch, Barclays says as stock surges
summary: Barclays upgraded AMD's stock to overweight from equal weight, leading to a more than 6% surge in AMD shares. Analyst Blayne Curtis believes AMD's Genoa and Bergamo platforms will enable further market-share gains against Intel. The upgrade also suggests AMD could benefit from Meta reaccelerating its spending.

title: AMD earnings face even more scrutiny after ‘astonishingly bad’ Intel outlook
summary: AMD's upcoming earnings report is under increased scrutiny following Intel's "astonishingly bad" outlook, particularly regarding inventory and data-center issues. CEO Lisa Su had previously expressed confidence that AMD would end 2022 in a stronger position, and the market will now evaluate that claim in light of rival Intel's struggles. AMD is scheduled to report its results after market close on Tuesday.

title: AMD CEO promises to keep taking data-center from Intel even as cloud demand pauses following 'strong' 2022
summary: AMD CEO Lisa Su has pledged to continue gaining data-center market share from Intel, despite an anticipated pause in cloud demand after a robust 2022. Following Intel's worst year since the dot-com bust, AMD's stock rose as its Q1 2023 sales forecast of over $5 billion reassured Wall Street. This positive outlook comes as AMD's data-center sales grew, even with initial light demand from cloud customers.

title: Why AMD is faring much better than Intel in the same tough economy
summary: AMD is showing a much brighter short-term outlook compared to Intel, despite both operating in a difficult chip market. While Intel faces widespread declines, AMD's data center business is experiencing growth, aided by new chip introductions and its acquisition of Xilinx. Both companies are affected by a slumping PC market, but AMD expects to gain market share in that segment and grow its data center revenue at Intel's expense this year.

title: Data Center Sales Drive AMD's Q4 Resurgence
summary: AMD reported better-than-expected Q4 results, driven by strong data center sales which helped offset declining demand for PC chips. The company forecasts first-quarter revenue of up to $5.6 billion and expects its data center business to continue growing, allowing it to gain market share against rivals like Intel despite an overall chip glut.

title: AMD Ryzen 7000X3D CPUs with 3D V-Cache will start shipping later this month
summary: AMD has announced the pricing and availability for its Ryzen 7000X3D series processors, featuring 3D V-Cache technology to boost performance, especially for gaming. The Ryzen 9 7950X3D and Ryzen 9 7900X3D will launch on February 28, 2023, with the Ryzen 7 7800X3D following on April 6, 2023. AMD claims its flagship chip offers a 10% improvement over Intel's high-end processors for gaming.

title: Qualcomm Introduces the World's First 5G NR-Light Modem-RF System to Fuel a New Wave of 5G Devices
summary: Qualcomm Technologies has announced the Snapdragon X35 5G Modem-RF System, the world’s first 5G NR-Light modem-RF system, designed to bridge the gap between high-speed mobile broadband and low-bandwidth IoT devices. This new system aims to expand 5G to new use cases like smartwatches, XR glasses, and industrial IoT by offering smaller, more cost-efficient devices with longer battery life. Customer sampling is expected in the first half of 2023, with commercial devices launching by the first half of 2024.

title: Applied Materials stock rises on new chip-making system that helps lower costs
summary: Applied Materials Inc. shares rose after the company unveiled a new chip-making system designed to lower manufacturing costs for semiconductors. The system, called Centura Sculpta, promises to save fabs like TSMC and Intel $50 per wafer. This innovation led to a notable outperformance of Applied Materials stock compared to its peers and the broader semiconductor market.

title: Opinion: AMD stock is sliding after earnings, and these numbers show why
summary: Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) stock slid significantly after the company reported a first-quarter net loss of $139 million and a revenue decline to $5.3 billion. This downturn was largely attributed to substantial drops in PC sales and gaming, exacerbated by a big decline in profit for its key data-center group and an unoptimistic forecast. The chip maker's overall margin was severely impacted, leading to a nearly 7% drop in its shares in after-hours trading.

title: Growing chip supply helps Baxter slash backlog
summary: Baxter International significantly reduced its backlog for Front Line Care products by half in Q1, thanks to an improved supply of electromechanical components, including semiconductor chips. This improved availability has allowed the healthcare company to reduce spot purchasing, lower costs, and enhance operational predictability, though an elevated backlog still remains which the company aims to address throughout the year. Despite facing continued pressure from rising supply chain costs from suppliers, Baxter expresses cautious optimism about turning the corner on component supply.

title: Implications and Updates From China’s National People’s Conference
summary: China's annual "Two Sessions" parliamentary meeting revealed strategic policies for economic growth, trade, and technology, targeting a 5% GDP growth in 2023 driven by domestic consumption. The conference highlighted key implications for sectors like EVs, clean energy, cloud computing, biotechnology, and semiconductors, emphasizing self-reliance and technological innovation. Government restructuring and increased focus on digital infrastructure and R&D are expected to significantly impact various industries and investment themes in China.

title: Canaan unveils immersion-cooled Avalon Made A1366I Bitcoin miner
summary: Canaan has launched its new immersion-cooled Avalon Made A1366I Bitcoin miner, featuring a hashrate of 165 TH/s and an efficiency of 30 J/TH, which offers benefits like safer overclocking and extended lifespan. This release follows their earlier 13-series models and comes amidst competitive market conditions and fluctuating stock prices for the company, which was the first mining equipment manufacturer to go public.

title: Supermicro Launches Industry's First NVIDIA HGX H100 8 and 4-GPU H100 Servers with Liquid Cooling -- Reduces Data Center Power Costs by Up to 40%
summary: Supermicro has launched the industry's first NVIDIA HGX H100 8 and 4-GPU servers featuring liquid cooling, designed to significantly reduce data center power costs by up to 40%. These new rack-scale solutions accelerate deployment and increase performance for AI and HPC workloads, while also lowering operating expenses and improving Power Usage Effectiveness (PUE) by up to 86% in direct cooling costs. The systems offer up to 30x performance improvement over previous generations for large transformer models and boast advanced features like PCIe 5.0 and NVIDA H100 SXM5 Tensor Core GPUs.

title: Applied Materials plans $4B Silicon Valley R&D facility
summary: Applied Materials announced plans to invest up to $4 billion in a new Silicon Valley research and development facility. This "EPIC Center" will focus on advancing semiconductor manufacturing and is expected to house over $25 billion in research work within its first decade. The investment is contingent on receiving funding from the CHIPS and Science Act, aiming to accelerate the industry's ability to bring new technologies to market.

title: Applied Materials Launches Multibillion-Dollar R&D Platform in Silicon Valley to Accelerate Semiconductor Innovation
summary: Applied Materials, Inc. announced a multibillion-dollar investment to build the Equipment and Process Innovation and Commercialization (EPIC) Center in Silicon Valley. This facility will be the world’s largest and most advanced for collaborative semiconductor process technology and manufacturing equipment R&D, aiming to accelerate innovation and reduce the time to commercialization for new technologies. The center will provide dedicated space for chipmakers and university researchers, fostering collaboration and addressing critical industry challenges like talent shortages and R&D costs.

title: Applied Materials plans to build US$4bn R&D center
summary: Applied Materials plans to invest up to US$4 billion to construct a new Research and Development (R&D) center in Silicon Valley, aiming to accelerate semiconductor manufacturing innovation. This "EPIC Center" would be the largest R&D facility in the semiconductor industry and is envisioned to speed up the transition of academic research to factory production, while also potentially leveraging funding from the US CHIPS and Science Act. The project seeks to address technical challenges and attract talent crucial for the industry's growth.

title: Fidelity Metaverse ETF ETF Price, Holdings, & News (NASDAQ:FMET)
summary: This article provides an overview of the Fidelity Metaverse ETF (FMET), including its price, holdings, and recent news. FMET tracks a market cap-weighted index of equities related to the metaverse, launched on April 19, 2022, and is managed by Fidelity. The ETF has seen a significant increase in share price since the beginning of 2025 and lists its top institutional shareholders and key holdings.

title: Applied Materials' Big Bet: A ‘Unique’ $4B Chip R&D Center
summary: Applied Materials is investing up to $4 billion to build the "EPIC Center," a 180,000-square-foot semiconductor R&D facility in Silicon Valley. This unique center will bring together chipmakers, academics, and ecosystem partners to accelerate manufacturing innovation, reduce costs, and shorten product development timelines, especially crucial in the complex 'angstrom era' of chipmaking. The investment's final size is contingent on subsidies from the U.S. government’s CHIPS and Science Act.

title: ETF of the Week: Goldman Sachs Hedge Industry VIP ETF (GVIP)
summary: VettaFi’s Tom Lydon discusses the Goldman Sachs Hedge Industry VIP ETF (GVIP) which offers exposure to top holdings favored by hedge funds without an overweight toward any single stock. GVIP provides diversification across various companies, including some mid-cap and international stocks, making it a less volatile option for investors seeking innovative companies. It provides a consensus of top companies chosen by leading hedge fund managers, appealing to investors looking for strong, well-vetted companies.

title: Student profile: Gaining skills to work in signal integrity | Electrical, Computer & Energy Engineering
summary: Vivek Kamble, a professional master's student in high-speed digital engineering at CU Boulder, shares his journey from teaching in India to pursuing advanced studies in signal integrity. He highlights the practical curriculum and industry expert-taught courses that prepared him for multiple internship offers, including one with Advanced Micro Devices Inc. His advice emphasizes the high demand for signal integrity and high-speed digital engineers globally.

title: GlobalFoundries and STMicroelectronics finalize agreement for new 300mm semiconductor manufacturing facility in France
summary: GlobalFoundries and STMicroelectronics have finalized an agreement to establish a new 300mm semiconductor manufacturing facility in Crolles, France, first announced in July 2022. This joint venture, supported by significant financial aid from the French government and European Commission, aims to boost semiconductor production capacity in Europe. The facility represents a projected cost of 7.5 billion euro and will focus on technologies for key markets like automotive, industrial, IoT, and communication infrastructure.

title: Applied Materials Announces $4 Billion Investment In EPIC Center For R&D Collaboration
summary: Applied Materials is investing $4 billion into its new Equipment and Process Innovation and Commercialization (EPIC) Center, a collaborative R&D project designed to accelerate semiconductor production techniques. This initiative aims to reduce the time from foundational research to mass commercialization by 30% through overlapping R&D phases and fostering direct collaboration between universities, equipment makers, and chip companies. The EPIC Center will strengthen Applied Materials' position in the industry, benefit chip makers with faster product roadmaps, and provide invaluable learning opportunities for university students.

title: AMD launches new Instinct MI300X AI chip to take on Nvidia’s GPUs
summary: AMD has launched its new Instinct MI300X AI accelerator chip, designed to compete with Nvidia's GPUs in the generative AI market. The company also introduced its Infinity Architecture Platform, powered by eight MI300X chips, and its ROCm software ecosystem. Despite these announcements, AMD's stock fell due to a lack of major customer endorsements for the new chips and details on pricing.

title: AMD's AI chip challenge to Nvidia remains uphill fight with no big customers named
summary: AMD unveiled new details about its MI300X artificial intelligence chip, designed to challenge Nvidia's market dominance, but did not announce any major customers for the product. While the chip offers significant memory capacity aimed at cost reduction for AI services, the lack of customer commitments disappointed Wall Street, causing AMD's stock to fall. Analysts noted that Nvidia's strong market position is reinforced by its software ecosystem, which AMD is attempting to counter with its Rocm platform.

title: AMD is chasing down Nvidia in AI, but one analyst worries the company is ‘somewhat late’
summary: Advanced Micro Devices Inc. (AMD) is pursuing the lucrative AI data-center market, estimated to be worth $150 billion, following recent product announcements. While many analysts praised AMD's efforts, Bernstein analyst Stacy Rasgon expressed concerns that AMD is "somewhat late" to the AI race compared to rival Nvidia Corp. Rasgon noted that AMD's AI discussion offered limited "hard numbers" and a timeline that seemed delayed relative to the competition.

title: The A.I. Race Is Now Between Two Chip Giants Led by Taiwanese American CEOs
summary: The generative A.I. boom has intensified competition between semiconductor giants Nvidia and AMD, who are racing to produce advanced A.I. chips. AMD recently announced the MI300X, a direct competitor to Nvidia's H100, aiming to challenge Nvidia's dominant market share in the A.I. chip sector. Both companies are led by Taiwanese American CEOs, Jensen Huang of Nvidia and Lisa Su of AMD, who share similar backgrounds and have played pivotal roles in their companies' success in the semiconductor industry.

title: Fidelity Metaverse ETF Review and Aggregate Rating (FMET)
summary: The Fidelity Metaverse ETF (FMET) has an aggregate rating of "Moderate Buy" with an average price target equal to its current share price of $36.66. The rating is based on 613 analyst ratings covering 20 companies (69.5% of the portfolio) over the past year. The ETF's top holdings include major tech companies like AMD, Alphabet, Apple, and NVIDIA.

title: Artificial Intelligence Opens a Generational Opportunity for Chipmakers
summary: The article discusses how the expansion of AI applications, especially large language models, is creating a "generational opportunity" for chipmakers. It highlights the projected growth of AI chip spending to nearly $165 billion by the end of the decade, primarily benefiting GPU-based chip providers like Nvidia, and notes that the demand for specialized AI hardware is leading to significant investments, partnerships, and a potential "long capital investment cycle" for the semiconductor industry. The article also examines how this shift will impact traditional CPU providers and accelerate the replacement of legacy computing infrastructure with AI-first hardware.

title: AMD, Broadcom stocks both drop for seventh straight session
summary: Advanced Micro Devices Inc. (AMD) and Broadcom Inc. (AVGO) experienced their seventh consecutive day of stock losses on Monday, marking their worst losing streaks since 2022. AMD shares fell 2.3% to close at $107.51, which is 33.6% below their record high from November 2021.

title: Chipmaker Micron beats on demand from booming AI, easing glut
summary: Micron Technology exceeded third-quarter revenue estimates driven by high demand for its memory chips in the rapidly expanding artificial intelligence sector and an easing supply glut in traditional markets. The company's shares rose over 2% after reporting stronger-than-expected earnings and anticipating improved pricing trends. Despite ongoing U.S.-China tech tensions impacting its presence in the Chinese market, Micron expressed confidence in the memory industry's recovery.

title: Stock of the week - Advanced Micro Devices (29.06.2023)
summary: This article discusses the potential impact of new US chip export restrictions to China on Advanced Micro Devices (AMD). While such restrictions negatively affected semiconductor stocks, AMD's exposure may be limited as China's share of its revenue has significantly decreased. The article also compares AMD's stock performance to Nvidia and Intel, noting Nvidia's stronger recovery from the 2022 sell-off.

title: Advanced Micro Devices Inc. – More market share gains expected
summary: Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) is expected to gain further market share in the data center CPU market and capitalize on opportunities to expand its presence in the data center GPU market due to increased generative AI adoption. The company's margins are projected to grow post-acquisition of Xilinx and Pensando, driven by increasing revenue contributions from its Data Centre and Embedded segments. Phillip Securities Research initiates coverage with an Accumulate recommendation and a target price of US$125.00, anticipating marginal revenue growth in FY23e and re-acceleration in FY24e.

title: Semiconductor Stocks Are Hot -- So Is Their Long-Term Outlook
summary: Semiconductor stocks and related ETFs, like the VanEck Semiconductor ETF (SMH), have experienced significant growth this year, driven largely by enthusiasm for artificial intelligence, particularly due to companies like Nvidia. While concerns about valuation exist, analysts believe the long-term outlook remains attractive, bolstered by a rebounding PC and smartphone market, and the massive potential of AI development across industries.

title: Aehr Reports Record Revenue and Profit for Fiscal 2023 and Guides for Over 50% Increase in Revenue for Fiscal 2024 on Strength from Semiconductor Wafer Level Test and Burn-in Demand
summary: Aehr Test Systems announced record financial results for fiscal 2023, with net sales reaching $65.0 million and GAAP net income of $14.6 million, driven by demand for semiconductor wafer level test and burn-in products. The company also provided strong guidance for fiscal 2024, projecting revenue of at least $100 million, a 50% increase, and GAAP net income of at least $28 million, reflecting over 90% growth. This growth is attributed to increased adoption of their FOX systems and WaferPak Contactors for silicon carbide in electric vehicles, as well as new opportunities in silicon photonics and gallium nitride markets.

title: U.S. chipmaker AMD to invest $400 million in India by 2028
summary: U.S. chipmaker Advanced Micro Devices (AMD.O) announced a significant investment of $400 million in India over the next five years, including the establishment of its largest design center in Bengaluru, creating 3,000 new engineering jobs. This move aligns with India's efforts to become a chipmaking hub, attracting other major players like Applied Materials and Micron with its incentive programs. AMD's expansion underscores the country's growing importance in the global semiconductor industry.

title: AMD to establish $400M chip design center in India
summary: Advanced Micro Devices Inc. (AMD) announced plans to invest $400 million in a new chip research and engineering center in Bangalore, India, which will be its largest design center globally with 3,000 engineers. This expansion will bring AMD's total headcount in India to over 9,000 employees. The move follows similar investments by other major chipmakers like Micron Inc. and Applied Materials Inc. in India.

title: AMD earnings preview: Is the company ceding ground to Intel?
summary: This article previews AMD's upcoming earnings report, questioning whether the company is losing market share to Intel. Historically, Intel's struggles have benefited AMD, but Intel's recent performance suggests a potential shift. Wall Street will be looking for confirmation of this trend in AMD's latest quarterly results.

title: AMD stock rises 3% after earnings beat, CEO predicts ‘multiple winners’ in AI race
summary: Advanced Micro Devices Inc. (AMD) shares rose 2.7% after hours following an earnings beat, with its CEO predicting "multiple winners" in the AI race. The company's PC sales slightly exceeded estimates, while data-center sales were just under projections. This performance follows Intel Corp.'s recent report of a data-center beat and strong PC sales.

title: Opinion: AMD’s AI era to begin near year’s end, but it’s looking more like a 2024 story
summary: Advanced Micro Devices Inc. needs flawless execution for the launch of its first AI-targeted graphics chips. While AMD projected better-than-expected Q3 revenue, Wall Street is more focused on Q4, when the company plans to launch its first GPU chips for AI acceleration in data centers, suggesting its AI era will truly take off in 2024.

title: JP Morgan Maintains Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) Neutral Recommendation
summary: JP Morgan has maintained a Neutral recommendation for Advanced Micro Devices (AMD), with an average one-year price target suggesting a 19.45% upside. The article highlights strong institutional ownership, projected revenue growth, and key financial holdings in the company. title: SOSA aligned wideband multichannel RF digitizers from Analog Devices aim at reduced SWaP
summary: Analog Devices has introduced the ADSY1100 series of wideband multichannel RF digitizers, designed in a 3U VPX SOSA-aligned format. These digitizers are intended for use in military and aerospace applications such as electronic warfare, radar, and communications, emphasizing reduced size, weight, and power (SWaP). The system features ADI's "Apollo" MXFE device with high DAC and ADC sample rates and integrated DSP to free up FPGA resources for mission-specific processing.
