summary: Aehr Test Systems has secured a major order for its FOX-NP wafer level test and burn-in system for Silicon Carbide (SiC) devices from a prominent semiconductor company. This system, featuring new advanced voltage channel modules, will be used for engineering, qualification, and small lot production, with plans to transition to high-volume production using Aehr's FOX-XP systems. The customer, a leading semiconductor firm with global operations, is entering the SiC market to address applications in automotive, industrial, and electrification infrastructure.

title: The top performing funds that beat the S&P 500 in Q1
summary: This article highlights the top-performing US equity funds in Q1 2024 that outperformed the S&P 500 index. Funds from GQG, Artemis, and Alger are featured, with GQG Partners U.S. Equity leading the pack. The piece details the investment strategies of these funds and specific holdings that contributed to their success.

title: AMD Advances Open Source Initiative with MES Firmware Release for Radeon GPUs
summary: AMD announced its plan to open-source the Micro Engine Scheduler (MES) firmware for its Radeon GPUs, enhancing user control and accessibility. This move directly addresses lobbying efforts from companies like Tiny Corp and could facilitate the integration of third-party chiplets. The company also anticipates significant growth from its MI300s, projecting substantial revenue increases in the coming fiscal years.

title: TSMC's $6.6bn Arizona deal the latest in the CHIPS Act rollout
summary: The Biden administration has announced a preliminary agreement for up to $6.6 billion in grants and $5 billion in loans for Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company (TSMC) under the CHIPS program. This investment, combined with TSMC's planned expansion in Arizona, totals $65 billion and aims to restart the semiconductor industry in the U.S. The Commerce Department expects the U.S. to produce about 20% of the world’s most advanced chips by 2030, a goal supported by the CHIPS funding and noted for its potential political implications in swing states.

title: Acrivon To Privately Place $130 Mln Of Shares; Stock Soars In Pre-market
summary: Acrivon Therapeutics, Inc. announced a private investment in public equity (PIPE) deal to sell 8,235,000 shares at $8.50 and pre-funded warrants, expecting to raise approximately $130 million. This funding will support the advancement of its lead clinical asset ACR-368, its preclinical pipeline, and the expansion of its AP3 platform and AI/machine learning capabilities. Following the announcement, Acrivon's stock (ACRV) soared by 72% in pre-market trading on the Nasdaq.

title: Abbott Laboratories to close Bay Area site; almost 200 jobs to be cut
summary: Abbott Laboratories is closing its Fairfield, California location later this year, leading to the layoff of 195 employees. The company, known for brands like Similac and Pedialyte, attributed a decrease in its annual sales to an anticipated decline in COVID-19 testing-related sales, despite overall sales growth in the fourth quarter. Fairfield Mayor Cathrine Moy expressed frustration over the timing of the layoffs and the company's decision to discontinue the nutritional bar previously made at the plant.

title: Intel Builds World’s Largest Neuromorphic System to Enable More Sustainable AI
summary: Intel has developed Hala Point, the world's largest neuromorphic system, featuring 1.15 billion neurons and 1,152 Loihi 2 processors to address the efficiency and sustainability challenges of AI. Deployed at Sandia National Laboratories, this system aims to advance brain-inspired AI research and future real-time continuous learning for various applications. It achieves state-of-the-art computational efficiencies, rivaling and exceeding GPU and CPU architectures, and promises significant energy savings for future AI deployments.

title: Steering Clients Through Unstable Markets
summary: Paul Schatz, president of Heritage Capital, discussed with etf.com his strategies for navigating client portfolios through current market instability characterized by higher inflation and interest rates. He has reduced exposure to "hot" AI and tech stocks, finding new opportunities in "unloved" sectors like pharmaceuticals, chemicals, and staples. Schatz also shared his market outlook, anticipating a first-quarter peak followed by a minor pullback and potential for fresh highs over the summer, while also discussing his cautious approach to bonds.

summary: Amidst the AI boom led by Nvidia, Morningstar analysts identify Infineon Technologies, STMicroelectronics, MediaTek, and Skyworks Solutions as undervalued semiconductor stocks. title: US to Provide $6.1 Billion for Micron Technology Chip Plants
summary: The Biden administration will provide $6.1 billion in government support for Micron Technology to produce advanced memory computer chips in New York and Idaho. This funding, from the 2022 CHIPS and Science Act, aims to revive the manufacturing sector, create 50,000 jobs, and bolster domestic semiconductor production. Micron plans to invest a total of $100 billion in upstate New York over two decades and $15 billion in Boise, Idaho.

summary: This article, part five of a personal history of EDA, details the acquisition era of Electronic Design Automation (EDA) and the significant role played by leading companies like Cadence, Synopsys, and Mentor Graphics. summary: Advanced Micro Devices (NASDAQ: AMD) is set to release its Q1 earnings, with analysts expecting revenue of $5.46 billion and earnings of 61 cents per share. While many analysts are bullish due to strong AI MI300 and EPYC performance, they also highlight risks such as market share declines, intense competition, and macroeconomic uncertainties that could impact the semiconductor industry. summary: Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) reported an increase in revenues and adjusted earnings for the first quarter of 2024. title: AMD is the latest company to show that AI is an expensive proposition
summary: Advanced Micro Devices Inc. (AMD) shares slid 9% after its latest earnings report, highlighting that artificial intelligence is an expensive endeavor for both chip buyers and manufacturers. AMD discussed increased investment spending to support its AI product portfolio, which is impacting the gross-margin profile for its data-center graphics processing units. This indicates that while AI presents significant opportunities, it also demands substantial financial commitment.

summary: Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) shares fell by about 7% after its forecast for AI chip sales for 2024, at roughly $4 billion, failed to meet Wall Street's expectations, despite being an increase from its prior estimate. summary: Liqid's composability technology aims to transform Dell servers into powerful AI model training systems by enabling a single Dell R760 server to access up to 30 NVIDIA L40S GPUs. This UltraStack configuration, developed with Dell and NVIDIA, promises significant reductions in capital and operational expenses while boosting AI performance, efficiency, and sustainability. Liqid's SmartStack technology also allows efficient allocation of GPU resources to multiple clients or modular server nodes, supporting various Dell PowerEdge systems.

title: Advanced Micro Devices to set up an R&D center in Taiwan, ministry says
summary: Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) has applied to establish a research and development (R&D) center in Taiwan under the government's "A+ Industrial Innovative R&D Program." The investment is estimated at NT$5 billion (US$155 million), with the ministry setting conditions such as collaborating with Taiwanese IC designers and recruiting foreign talent. This move is part of Taiwan's broader strategy to become a global R&D hub, attracting major tech companies like ASML, Lam Research, Applied Materials, and Nvidia.

title: NVIDIA Announces Financial Results for First Quarter Fiscal 2025
summary: NVIDIA reported record quarterly revenue of $26.0 billion for Q1 FY25, a 262% increase year-over-year, driven by strong demand for AI in its Data Center segment. The company also announced a ten-for-one forward stock split and a 150% increase in its quarterly cash dividend. NVIDIA outlined significant platform advancements, including the Blackwell platform and Spectrum-X, positioning itself for continued growth in the AI market.

title: With the rise of Ethernet, Nvidia Infiniband is being encroached upon
summary: Nvidia's InfiniBand sales are being encroached upon by the growing demand for Ethernet in data centers, particularly from hyperscale enterprises and cloud builders. While InfiniBand still accounts for a large portion of Nvidia's network sales, the company is actively pushing its Spectrum X Ethernet products, expecting them to become a multi-billion dollar product line. Despite this internal cannibalization, Nvidia anticipates continued strong growth, with CEO Jensen Huang emphasizing the company's commitment to both InfiniBand and Ethernet as computing structures, alongside NVLink.

title: Data Center Powerplay: The Chips Have to Go Somewhere
summary: Citi Research forecasts a significant surge in data center capacity, driven by the power demands of Generative AI (GenAI), expecting a compound annual growth of 17% to 100 GW by 2030, up from 33 GW in 2023. GenAI workloads are projected to account for over half of this demand by 2030, with concerns raised about utilities' ability to meet the escalating power needs. The report estimates annual peak power requirements for US data centers to be 5 GW to 8 GW through 2030, posing a potential bottleneck if supply constraints persist.

title: Computer Industry Joins NVIDIA to Build AI Factories and Data Centers for the Next Industrial Revolution
summary: NVIDIA, in collaboration with top computer manufacturers, unveiled a new array of NVIDIA Blackwell architecture-powered systems, featuring Grace CPUs and NVIDIA networking, designed for building AI factories and data centers. These systems aim to drive the next wave of generative AI breakthroughs, with offerings ranging from single to multi-GPUs and various cooling technologies. Key industry players like ASRock Rack, ASUS, GIGABYTE, and Supermicro are among those delivering these advanced AI systems.

title: ‘Accelerate Everything,’ NVIDIA CEO Says Ahead of COMPUTEX
summary: NVIDIA CEO Jensen Huang, speaking ahead of COMPUTEX, emphasized a "major shift in computing" driven by AI and accelerated computing, detailing new semiconductors, software, and systems. Huang announced a one-year rhythm for new semiconductors, including the upcoming Rubin platform, and highlighted accelerated computing as sustainable, driving down costs. He also showcased strong industry adoption of NVIDIA technologies for AI factories, next-generation networking with Spectrum-X, and the transformation of generative AI development with NVIDIA NIM, alongside the integration of AI assistants into RTX AI PCs and the adoption of NVIDIA Robotics for industrial digitization.

title: AMD-Nvidia ETFs in Focus Amid New Chip Introductions
summary: AMD and Nvidia are at the forefront of AI chip development, with both companies introducing new generations of AI processors to meet surging demand. AMD announced its MI325X accelerator and future MI350 and MI400 series, while Nvidia unveiled its Rubin platform, committing to annual chip releases. The intense competition and rapid advancements in AI semiconductor technology are drawing significant investor interest, with several ETFs offering exposure to both chipmakers.

title: AMD announces new AI chips amid intensifying competition with Nvidia, Intel
summary: AMD announced new AI chips at the Computex tech conference in Taipei, emphasizing AI as its top priority and a transformative force in the computing market. This move intensifies its competition with rivals Nvidia and Intel, both of whom are also rapidly introducing new AI-focused processors. AMD plans to release new AI chip technology annually, outlining a roadmap for Instinct accelerators and EPYC server processors through 2026.

title: Cisco Live Day 1 news brings together networking and security
summary: Cisco Live's 2024 event highlights the company's focus on integrating networking and security, especially in the context of AI's growing influence. Cisco announced innovations like Nexus HyperFabric with Nvidia and Nutanix, and advancements in its Security Cloud, aiming to simplify operations and enhance threat protection across its installed base. The company emphasizes a strategy of "melting security into the network" to leverage its heritage and address the evolving tech landscape.

title: Coherent Corp. Gets a New CEO
summary: Coherent Corp. announced James R. Anderson as its new CEO, replacing Vincent D. Mattera, Jr. Anderson's appointment, following his successful tenure at Lattice Semiconductor, caused Coherent's stock to jump 23% while Lattice's fell 15.5%. The move signals Coherent's focus on AI, datacom, and industrial markets, building on Mattera's legacy of significant growth and acquisitions.

title: South Korean AI chip developers Rebellions and Sapeon to merge
summary: South Korean AI chip developers Rebellions Inc and Sapeon Korea Inc are merging to challenge global AI chip leader Nvidia. The consolidation, driven by Sapeon parent SK Telecom, aims to secure a strong position in the global AI semiconductor market within the next two to three years, with the merged company expected to launch by the end of the year. Rebellions will manage the merged entity, focusing on neural processing units (NPUs).

title: Archaea Energy and Republic Services celebrate first RNG plant in landmark partnership
summary: Archaea Energy, a bp subsidiary, and Republic Services have launched their first renewable natural gas (RNG) plant in Fort Wayne, Indiana, as part of their Lightning Renewables joint venture. This facility, utilizing Archaea Modular Design (AMD), is the first of approximately 40 planned landfill gas-to-RNG projects aiming to convert landfill gas into sustainable energy. Once operational, the Fort Wayne plant is expected to process enough gas to heat over 25,000 homes annually, significantly contributing to both companies' sustainability goals and increasing domestic energy production.

title: Nvidia Becomes Most Valuable Public Company, Topping Microsoft (Published 2024)
summary: Nvidia has surpassed Microsoft and Apple to become the world's most valuable public company, achieving a market capitalization of $3.34 trillion. This rapid ascent, largely attributed to the boom in generative artificial intelligence and high demand for its GPUs, highlights the transformative impact of AI on leading corporations. CEO Jensen Huang's early bet on GPUs for AI systems has positioned Nvidia to control over 80 percent of the market for AI chips.

title: Nvidia surpasses Microsoft to become the world’s most valuable company
summary: Nvidia Corp. has surpassed Microsoft Corp. to become the world's most valuable publicly traded company, reaching a market capitalization of $3.34 trillion. This milestone follows a surge in Nvidia's stock, driven by its dominance in the AI chip market, particularly with its GPUs essential for generative AI development. The company's exceptional growth contrasts with Microsoft and Apple, which have also benefited from AI but not to the same extent, solidifying Nvidia's unique position in the tech landscape.

title: Nvidia beats Microsoft to become world's most valuable company
summary: Nvidia has surpassed Microsoft to become the world's most valuable company with a market capitalization of $3.34tn, driven by its dominance in AI chips. Its stock has nearly doubled this year, reflecting explosive growth fueled by demand for its technology, though some analysts are cautious about future gains amid increasing competition.

summary: Piper Sandler has named AMD a top stock pick due to its relative valuation and potential benefits from easing supply constraints on its AI offerings. title: AOSL is a new GB200 supplier, leading beneficiaries of NVIDIA's process certification changes
summary: Alpha and Omega Semiconductor Ltd (AOSL) is expected to become a new supplier for NVIDIA's GB200 AI servers, benefiting from NVIDIA's accelerated supplier certification process. This change allows suppliers with existing HGX/DGX H100 certifications to more easily qualify for GB200, leading AOSL to potentially gain market share from competitors by the end of 2024. Analyst Ming-Chi Kuo highlights this as a significant investment focus for the second half of the year.

summary: This article provides an introduction to NVIDIA, highlighting its transformation from a GPU manufacturer to a systems company offering hardware and an ecosystem for developers. The piece emphasizes NVIDIA's role in advancing AI for personalized and intelligent customer interactions across various sectors.

title: Intel Demonstrates First Fully Integrated Optical I/O Chiplet
summary: Intel Corporation's Integrated Photonics Solutions (IPS) Group has demonstrated the industry's first fully integrated bidirectional optical compute interconnect (OCI) chiplet, co-packaged with an Intel CPU and running live data. This OCI chiplet is designed to enhance AI infrastructure for data centers and high-performance computing by providing higher bandwidth, lower power consumption, and longer reach than traditional electrical or pluggable optical solutions. This breakthrough is expected to revolutionize high-speed data processing for AI, enabling greater scalability and more efficient resource utilization.

title: Microchip Rad-hard MCU Targeted at Aerospace and Defense Market
summary: Microchip Technology has launched the SAMD21RT, a radiation-tolerant Arm Cortex-M0+ based 32-bit microcontroller, for the aerospace and defense market. This MCU is designed for space-constrained applications, offering high performance in harsh environments with radiation tolerance up to 50krad TID and SEL immunity up to 78MeV.cm²/mg. Building on existing SAMD21 MCUs, it simplifies design for radiation-tolerant applications while supporting a wide temperature range and integrating essential analog and digital peripherals.

title: Seagate names Futoshi Niizumaas New Vice President Asia Pacific and Japan Sales
summary: Seagate Technology Holdings plc has appointed Futoshi Niizuma as Vice President for Asia-Pacific and Japan sales. He will be responsible for managing sales and support operations in the region. Niizuma, who joined Seagate in 2009, previously led the company's Japan sales team and held senior roles at Kenwood Corporation and Advanced Micro Devices.

title: Spear Alpha (SPRX) 1Q24 Quarterly Letter
summary: The Spear Alpha ETF (SPRX) experienced an underperformance in 1Q24 compared to the S&P 500 and Nasdaq Composite, posting a 4.22% gain versus 10.56% and 9.31% respectively, primarily due to rising interest rates and investor shift towards defensive mega-caps. The fund is adjusting its strategy by increasing idea velocity and reallocating investments in the data center value chain, particularly in materials and power generation, while maintaining a balanced approach between software and hardware to capitalize on future opportunities in the evolving technology cycle amplified by AI. Despite short-term challenges, the management expresses confidence for the rest of the year driven by increased capex spending in hyperscalers and broadening data center investments.

title: Applied Materials reveals chip wiring innovations for energy-efficient computing
summary: Applied Materials has introduced new chip wiring innovations designed to enhance energy efficiency in computing, particularly for 2-nanometer node manufacturing and beyond. These advancements utilize new materials like Ruthenium Cobalt liners and enhanced low-k dielectrics, which reduce electrical resistance by up to 25% and capacitance by up to 3%, ultimately supporting the development of trillion-transistor chips for AI and graphics processing. The company's solutions aim to improve performance-per-watt, strengthen chips for 3D stacking, and address challenges in scaling Moore's Law, with adoption already seen by leading logic and memory chipmakers including Samsung and TSMC.

title: U.S. Navy Funds Mercury to Advance Chip-Scale Technologies
summary: The U.S. Navy has awarded Mercury Systems, Inc. a $13.2 million contract to advance chip-scale technologies for radar and electronic warfare systems. This initiative, part of the Office of Naval Research’s ORCA program, aims to reduce development timelines by increasing the modularity of components at the chip level. Mercury will develop a next-generation RF System-in-Package, integrating commercial chips from major semiconductor providers to create smaller and lighter solutions.

title: AMD to Buy European AI Lab Silo in Race Against Nvidia
summary: Advanced Micro Devices Inc. has agreed to acquire Helsinki-based Silo AI for $665 million in cash to enhance its artificial intelligence capabilities. This acquisition aims to help AMD narrow the competitive gap with Nvidia Corp. Silo AI, Europe's largest private AI lab, will continue to be led by its co-founder and CEO Peter Sarlin, becoming part of AMD's Artificial Intelligence Group.

title: ASE launches new testing facility in San Jose on AI demand
summary: ASE Technology Holding Co (ASE) has opened a second testing facility in San Jose, California, through its subsidiary ISE Labs Inc, to meet the increasing demand for advanced chip testing in AI and high-performance computing. This expansion doubles ISE Labs’ R&D and business space, aiming to strengthen the US semiconductor supply chain. ASE plans to invest about US$200 million in the new facility and has increased its overall capital spending to cope with growing demand.

summary: Aehr Test Systems announced its fiscal 2024 fourth-quarter and full-year financial results, reporting record full-year revenue of $66.2 million and providing fiscal 2025 guidance of at least $70 million in revenue. summary: Intel's shares experienced their largest drop since 1974, plummeting 26% to their lowest price since 2013, after the chipmaker reported a significant earnings miss and announced a restructuring that includes laying off over 15% of its workforce. summary: AMD announced its plan to acquire server maker ZT Systems for $4.9 billion in cash and stock to expand its AI chip and hardware portfolio and bolster its competition with Nvidia. While investors were initially disappointed by the stock's 17% decline post-earnings, the company expects significant growth in the latter half of 2026 with the release of new powerful AI accelerators like the MI450. Analysts remain largely bullish on AMD, with a consensus price target suggesting a 41% upside.

title: Looking Into Advanced Micro Devices Inc's Recent Short Interest

title: WJ Financial Advisors LLC Purchases New Stake in Advanced Micro Devices, Inc. $AMD

title: The Bull Case For Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) Could Change Following AI-Focused Q4 Beat And New CMO Appointment
summary: Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) recently reported strong Q4 2025 results with increased sales and net income, alongside the appointment of Ariel Kelman as CMO, emphasizing its commitment to AI and data center growth. The company's future hinges on converting its AI product lineup into sustainable earnings despite competition and high investment needs. While a strong AI performance is anticipated, investors should consider rising R&D costs and dependence on third-party manufacturing.

title: Avanda Investment Management Pte. Ltd. Acquires New Position in Advanced Micro Devices, Inc. $AMD
summary: Avanda Investment Management Pte. Ltd. has acquired a new stake of 4,500 shares in Advanced Micro Devices (AMD), valued at approximately $728,000, making it their 20th largest holding.
